H0.text: The skin is where pressure receptors are mainly found.

H1.text: The nerves are the primary location where pressure receptors are mainly found.

H2.text: The tissue is where pressure receptors are mainly found.

H3.text: The muscles are where pressure receptors are mainly found.

A4.text: Cutaneous mechanoreceptors are located in the skin, like other cutaneous receptors.

A5.text: Lamellar corpuscles, or Pacinian corpuscles, are deformation or pressure receptors located in the skin and also in various internal organs.
